summary: This document is email correspondence between a paralegal and an associate warden regarding FOIA litigation filed by the NY Times for Epstein records. It discusses the location and handling of various logbooks from the Metropolitan Correctional Center related to Epstein's incarceration and suicide watch, and the process for providing these documents to the FBI.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.role: Associate Warden at Metropolitan Correctional Center
persons.context: Correspondent providing information about Epstein-related logbooks and their handling; appears to be at the NY facility.

connections.description: Associate Warden provided photocopies of logbooks to Lt in the SIS department, who then released them to the FBI.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Watch Logging
events.description: Staff was assigned suicide watch duties for Epstein on the 2nd floor suicide watch area, as documented in the Suicide Watch log book.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Watch Logging
events.description: Inmate companion assumed suicide watch duties from staff for Epstein on the 2nd floor suicide watch area, as documented in the Suicide Watch log book.

events.title: Epstein Psychology Observation
events.description: Psychology observation log for Epstein was completed by an inmate companion on the 2nd floor suicide watch area.

events.title: Epstein Psychology Observation
events.description: Psychology observation log for Epstein was completed by an inmate companion on the 2nd floor suicide watch area.

events.title: FOIA Correspondence Regarding Epstein Logs
events.description: Email exchange regarding the location and handling of various logbooks related to Epstein's incarceration, in response to FOIA litigation by the NY Times.

keyFacts: Multiple specific logbooks were maintained for Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including Attorney Conference, Lobby Attorney, Visual Search, Psychology Observation, Suicide Watch, and Intake Screening Phone logs.
The original logbooks were turned over to the FBI via the SIS department (Lieutenant).
The Associate Warden maintained a personal electronic folder (h: drive) containing scanned documents responsive to Epstein-related FOIA requests.
The correspondence is part of FOIA litigation filed by the NY Times seeking Epstein records.
Logs detail activities and observations on specific dates in July 2019, including suicide watch and psychology observations, some completed by inmate companions.
